metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23982 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: Using techniques that built on the slipstream research, a malicious webpage could have scanned both an internal network's hosts as well as services running on the user's local machine utilizing WebRTC connections. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.9, Firefox < 87, and Thunderbird < 78.9.

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Samy Kamkar, Ben Seri, and Gregory Vishnepolsky

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '87.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in hirsute is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.21.04.2').
